klipper_tuning_tower_enable.label: Enable Tuning Tower
klipper_tuning_tower_enable.description:
Enable Klipper's tuning tower sequence to precisely tune a specified parameter at given intervals during the print.

Any models on the build plate will be affected by the tuning sequence.

klipper_tuning_tower_preset.label: Tuning Tower Presets
klipper_tuning_tower_preset.description:
Setting presets for common Tuning Tower calibrations. Only Tuning Tower settings will be affected by a preset unless the Apply Suggested Settings option is also enabled. This option is only available for specific presets and will adjust additional Klipper and Cura settings neccessary for the calibration.

Recommended to be used with Klipper's calibration models.

klipper_tuning_tower_override.label: Apply Suggested Settings
klipper_tuning_tower_override.description:
Applies additional Klipper settings necessary for the current calibration sequence. When enabled, a number of additional Klipper and Cura settings defined by the preset will be adjusted. Otherwise presets only affect Tuning Tower setting values. All changes are generally as described in the Klipper documentation.

Any changes to user-defined values are backed up and shown on screen.

Disable to restore changed settings to their previous state.

klipper_tuning_tower_command.label: Tuning Tower Command
klipper_tuning_tower_command.description:
The Klipper command to be executed during the tuning process. This value must be specified.

Common Examples:
SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE
SET_VELOCITY_LIMIT
SET_RETRACTION

Quotes automatically added to multi-word commands:
'SET_HEATER_TEMPERATURE HEATER=extruder'

klipper_tuning_tower_parameter.label: Tuning Tower Parameter
klipper_tuning_tower_parameter.description:
The parameter of the command to execute during the tuning process. This value must be specified.

Text should not contain spaces or special characters.

Common Examples:
FACTOR
ACCEL
RETRACT_LENGTH
TARGET

klipper_tuning_tower_start.label: Tuning Tower Start Value
klipper_tuning_tower_start.description:
The starting value of the parameter specified for the tuning process.

A value of '0' will effectively start with command disabled.

klipper_tuning_tower_skip.label: Tuning Tower Skip Height
klipper_tuning_tower_skip.description:
(Optional) The z-height in mm at which the tuning process will begin. Below this height only the start value will be used. If omitted, the tuning process simply begins at the first layer. This is often used to skip the initial layers of the print.

A value of '0' disables the skip height option.

klipper_tuning_tower_method.label: Tuning Tower Method
klipper_tuning_tower_method.description:
The adjustment method used for the tuning process.

Use FACTOR when precisely measuring the z-height of the tuning tower to determine the optimum value. Generally used to tune a wide range of values for features like pressure advance. This enables the optional band height setting to specify an incremental height adjustment.

Use STEP if the tower model has steps of discrete values which can be counted to determine the optimum value. Typically best suited for objects like temperature towers. This enables the required settings step delta and step height.

klipper_tuning_tower_factor.label: Tuning Tower Factor
klipper_tuning_tower_factor.description:
The factor used to continously adjust the start value throughout the tuning process. The value will change at a rate of factor per mm. This may be used in combination with band height.

A value greater than '0' is required.

To determine the best result, precisely measure the desired Z height then use the following formula:
START + FACTOR * Z_HEIGHT

klipper_tuning_tower_band.label: Tuning Tower Band Height
klipper_tuning_tower_band.description:
(Optional) The height in mm of each adjustment band. The value is adjusted at an average rate of factor per mm, but only adjusted in discrete bands of Z height.

A value of '0' disables the band height option.

Formula with band enabled:
START + FACTOR * ((floor(Z_HEIGHT / BAND) + .5) * BAND)

klipper_tuning_tower_step_delta.label: Tuning Tower Step Delta
klipper_tuning_tower_step_delta.description:
The step factor used to adjust the start value throughout the tuning process. The start value will change by step delta every step height in mm.

Value must be greater than '0' and used in combination with step height.

To determine the result, simply count the bands or labels on the model.

Formula:
START + STEP_DELTA * floor(Z_HEIGHT / STEP_HEIGHT)

klipper_tuning_tower_step_height.label: Tuning Tower Step Height
klipper_tuning_tower_step_height.description:
The incremental distance in mm at which step delta will adjust the start value throughout the tuning process.

Value must be greater than '0' and used in combination with step delta.

To determine the result, simply count the bands or labels on the model.

Formula:
START + STEP_DELTA * floor(Z_HEIGHT / STEP_HEIGHT)

klipper_pressure_advance_enable.label: Enable Pressure Advance Control
klipper_pressure_advance_enable.description:
Enables control of Pressure Advance in Klipper firmware. This feature can greatly sharpen the appearance of corners, improve line width consistency and reduce the need for retraction during non-extrusion moves. Supports control of individual mesh objects and multiple extruders.

To disable Pressure Advance, enable control and set necessary values to '0'.

This plugin is not compatible with Marlin's Linear Advance.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor.label: Pressure Advance Factor
klipper_pressure_advance_factor.description:
Extrusion coefficient for Pressure Advance in Klipper firmware.

Common values are 0.01 - 0.10 for direct drive and 0.20 - 0.80 for bowden extruders. Higher values will lead to excessive extruder movements which may result in missed extruder steps when accelerating/decelerating. Recommended for most users to avoid values above 0.50 when possible. Adjustments may be necessary for different materials, nozzles, etc.

A value of '0' will disable Pressure Advance in Klipper.

Changing any subsequent feature values will override this setting.

Default: 0 (Disable)

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_infill.label: Infill Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_infill.description:
Pressure Advance factor when printing infill. Adjustments could be used to minimize excessive extruder movements for certain infill types and high print speeds but reducing too much may increase stringing.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall.label: Wall Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall.description:
Pressure Advance factor used when printing walls. Optimized values can sharpen the appearance of corners, reduce bulging and optimize extrusion consistency when varying print speeds.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall_0.description:
Pressure Advance factor used for the outermost wall. Optimized values can greatly improve the appearance of corners.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_wall_x.description:
Pressure Advance factor used only for inner walls.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_topbotto.label: Top/Bottom Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_topbotto.description:
Pressure Advance factor used for top/bottom skin layers. Optimized value can improve surface appearance and line width consistency for these layers. High values may lead to excessive extruder movements.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_layer_0.description:
Pressure Advance factor used only during the first layer. Value will override every mesh object feature setting. Adjusting could be used to optimize line width consistency when varying print speed for this layer.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support.label: Support Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support.description:
Pressure Advance factor used for support infill and interface structures. Adjustments could be used to minimize excessive extruder movements but most users will not benefit from changing these values.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support_.label: Support Infill Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support_.description:
Pressure Advance factor used only for support infill.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support_.label: Support Interface Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_support_.description:
Pressure Advance factor used only for the support interface.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_prime_to.label: Prime Tower Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_prime_to.description:
Pressure Advance factor used when printing a prime tower. Most users will not benefit from adjusting this value.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.

klipper_pressure_advance_factor_skirt_br.label: Skirt/Brim Pressure Advance
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_skirt_br.description:
Pressure Advance factor used when printing skirts or brims. Most users will not benefit from adjusting this value.

A value of '0' disables pressure advance for this feature.
klipper_pressure_advance_factor_skirt_br.enabled: resolveOrValue('klipper_pressure_advance_enable') and (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled'))

machine_firmware_retract.label: Enable Firmware Retraction
machine_firmware_retract.description:
Enables G10 & G11 firmware retraction commands in gcode. This is a duplicate of the firmware retraction option normally hidden in machine settings. When enabled, Cura's standard retraction settings are ignored since it no longer has direct control over retraction behavior. Any specified retraction values will override current values in Klipper config.

This can only be used if firmware_retraction is enabled in Klipper config.

klipper_retract_distance.label: Retraction Distance
klipper_retract_distance.description:
The length in mm of material retracted during a G10 retract command. Cura's standard retraction setting is ignored as it no longer controls retractions directly. The firmware_retraction section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Klipper Default: 0 mm

A value of '-1.0' will disable control and use current retract_length in Klipper config.

Default: -1.0 (Disabled)

klipper_unretract_extra.label: Unretract Extra Length
klipper_unretract_extra.description:
The length in mm of extra material added to a G11 unretract command. A value above zero is generally not necessary but can be used to compensate for material oozing during travel moves. Only adjust if under-extrusion is consistently visible following retraction. Cura's standard retraction setting is ignored as it no longer controls retractions directly. The firmware_retraction section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Klipper Default: 0 mm

A value of '-1.0' will disable control and use current unretract_extra_length in Klipper config.

Default: -1.0 (Disabled)

klipper_retraction_speed.label: Retraction Speed
klipper_retraction_speed.description:
The speed in mm/s at which filament is retracted and primed during G10 & G11 commands. Cura's standard retraction setting is ignored as it no longer controls retractions directly. The firmware_retraction section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Klipper Min. Value: 1.0

A value of '0' will disable control and instead use current values in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_retract_speed.label: Retract Speed
klipper_retract_speed.description:
The speed at which filament is retracted during a G10 command. Cura's standard retraction setting is ignored as it no longer controls retractions directly. The firmware_retraction section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Klipper Min. Value: 1.0 | Default: 20 mm/s

A value of '0' will disable control and use current retract_speed in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_unretract_speed.label: Unretract Speed
klipper_unretract_speed.description:
The speed at which filament unretracts during a G11 command. Cura's standard retraction setting is ignored as it no longer controls retractions directly. The firmware_retraction section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Klipper Min. Value: 1.0 | Default: 10 mm/s

A value of '0' will disable control and use current unretract_speed in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_velocity_limits_enable.label: Enable Velocity Limit Control
klipper_velocity_limits_enable.description:
Enable control of Klipper's velocity and acceleration limits.

Not recommended to change unless you understand the ramifications of doing so.

klipper_velocity_limit.label: Velocity Limit
klipper_velocity_limit.description:
The maximum velocity limit in mm/s of the toolhead relative to the print. Print speeds will not be able to exceed this value. It is generally not necessary to adjust a printer's default value.

A value of '0' will disable control and not change current limit in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_accel_limit.label: Acceleration Limit
klipper_accel_limit.description:
The maximum acceleration limit in mm/s² of the toolhead relative to the print. If Cura's acceleration control is enabled those values also change max_accel so they will override this value. This is intended to adjust max_accel temporarily, such as in preparation for a tuning sequence.



A value of '0' will disable control and not change current limit in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_accel_to_decel_limit.label: Accel to Decel Limit
klipper_accel_to_decel_limit.description:
The maximum rate in mm/s² for how quickly the toolhead can switch from acceleration to deceleration. This is a pseudo acceleration used to reduce the top speed of short zig-zag moves which can cause excessive vibration. The default Klipper value is generally recommended which is calculated as half of the max_accel config value and does not dynamically change.



A value of '0' will disable control and not change current limit in Klipper config.

Default: 0 (Disabled)

klipper_corner_velocity_limit.label: Square Corner Velocity Limit
klipper_corner_velocity_limit.description:
The maximum velocity in mm/s of the toolhead during a 90 degree cornering move. A non-zero value can reduce changes in extruder flow rates when cornering by enabling instantaneous velocity changes. Corners with angles above 90 degrees will have a higher cornering velocity while corners with angles with less will have a lower cornering velocity.

A value of '0' is valid but not recommended and would force the toolhead to decelerate to a stop at each corner.

Klipper default is 5.0 mm/s.

A value of '-1.0' will disable control and not change current limit in Klipper config.

Default: -1.0 (Disabled)

klipper_input_shaper_enable.label: Enable Input Shaper Control
klipper_input_shaper_enable.description:
Enable control of Klipper's input shaper commands. The input_shaper section must be enabled in Klipper config.

Only recommended to enable for calibration purposes.

klipper_shaper_freq_x.label: Shaper Frequency X
klipper_shaper_freq_x.description:
The frequency in Hz for the X axis input shaper. Typically a resonance frequency of the X axis to suppress.

The Klipper default of '0' will disable input shaping for X axis.

A value of '-1' will disable control and use current shaper_freq_x in Klipper config.

Default: -1 (Disabled)

klipper_shaper_freq_y.label: Shaper Frequency Y
klipper_shaper_freq_y.description:
The frequency in Hz for the Y axis input shaper. Typically a resonance frequency of the Y axis to suppress.

The Klipper default of '0' will disable input shaping for Y axis.

A value of '-1' will disable control and use current shaper_freq_y in Klipper config.

Default: -1 (Disabled)

klipper_shaper_type.label: Shaper Type
klipper_shaper_type.description:
The type of input shaper to use for both X and Y axes.

Supported shapers:
ZV, MZV, ZVD, EI, 2HUMP_EI, 3HUMP_EI

Klipper Default: MZV

Not specifying type will disable control and use current shaper_type in Klipper config.

klipper_shaper_type_x.label: Shaper Type X
klipper_shaper_type_x.description:
The type of input shaper to use for only the X axis.

Klipper Default: MZV

klipper_shaper_type_y.label: Shaper Type Y
klipper_shaper_type_y.description:
The input shaper type to use only for the Y axis.

Klipper Default: MZV

klipper_damping_ratio_x.label: Damping Ratio X
klipper_damping_ratio_x.description:
Damping ratio of X axis vibrations used by input shapers to improve vibration suppression. This generally requires no tuning and is not recommended to change from default value.

A value of '-1' will disable control and use current damping_ratio_x in Klipper config.

Default: -1 (Disabled)

klipper_damping_ratio_y.label: Damping Ratio Y
klipper_damping_ratio_y.description:
Damping ratio of Y axis vibrations used by input shapers to improve vibration suppression. This generally requires no tuning and is not recommended to change from default value.

A value of '-1' will disable control and use current damping_ratio_y in Klipper config.

Default: -1 (Disabled)
